The World's Most Versatile Camera - Wear it. Mount it. Love it.GoPro’s versatile cameras and accessories enable people to self-capture immersive and engaging footage of themselves enjoying their favorite activities. From extreme to mainstream, GoPro’s HERO® line of wearable and gear-mountable capture devices are transforming the way consumers, professional athletes, and video production professionals capture, manage and share meaningful photo and video content. Based in San Mateo, California, GoPro’s products are sold through more than 25,000 stores in over 100 countries worldwide and direct via GoPro.com. GoPro branded content is shared and enjoyed by millions of people on popular media channels such as Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Vimeo and YouTube. GOPRO® and HERO® are trademarks or registered trademarks of GoPro, Inc. in the United States and other countries.  Full-cycle recruiting for all levels and departments within GoPro that consists of:Resume reviews, job posting, phone interviews, scheduling, in-person interviews, salary negotiatons, offer letter creation, networking events, new hire orientation, contractor conversions.Want to work for GoPro? Check out the career site: http://gopro.com/careers/
VP of Account Services (Recruiting and Business Development)

Staffing Strong is a national recruitment firm specializing in the placement of highly skilled Marketing, Creative, and Digital professionals. We focus on executive search as well as contract, contract to hire and permanent placement.Major Accomplishments: •	Recruited to launch a start-up staffing agency in two markets (Phoenix and San Diego) from the ground up. •	Working a full desk: Performing both sales and recruiting functions, for temporary and permanent placement divisions simultaneously, in multiple marketsJob Duties:•	Full Life Cycle Recruiting for a variety of positions including marketing, creative, interactive, and technical•	Relentlessly pursuing top talent•	Continuously seeking out new recruiting sources: partnering with Career Services departments to find top grads, attending networking events/users groups, internet searches/portfolio websites/job boards•	Actively interviewing an average of 25 candidates/week•	Screening applicants as well as actively headhunting new talent•	Managing an applicant tracking system - ensuring all files are accurate and up to date•	Effectively negotiating salary and benefits packages•	Seeking out new clients and working with existing clients one-on-one to determine their marketing, advertising and creative needs•	Recruiting talent with hard to find, niche skill sets •	Strategizing, overseeing and managing client accounts and projects from inception through to completion •	Managing client expectations, project timelines, deliverables and budgets•	Partnering with executives to accomplish staffing goals•	Lead generation and qualification•	Sales presentations•	Staying on top of industry trends (digital, traditional, marketing, advertising, creative)•	Attending industry conferences, workshops, trade shows and networking events
La Jolla, CA and Phoenix, AZ

The Creative Group specializes in placing highly skilled creative, advertising, marketing, web and public relations professionals with a variety of firms.Major Accomplishments: •	Recruited to launch The Creative Group in two different markets in two different states. •	Successfully built both temporary and permanent placement teams from the ground up while managing a book of business/talent pool of my own.•	Full desk: Sales and recruiting (while managing a team of recruiters and account managers)•	Partnered with other lines of business (tech, accounting, office team, etc) to fill a variety of roles for their clientsJob Duties:•	Successfully developed my own book of business (recruiting both clients and candidates)•	Hired, trained and managed a team of top performers; both business development professionals and recruiters.•	Served as the main point of contact for clients•	Assisted clients in determining their creative needs, budgets and timelines

Job Duties:•	Continually increased employer database through participation in trade shows, networking events, employer visits, serving on the Board of Directors for professional affiliations, volunteering within the community and cold calling	•	Directly assisted students and graduates in securing full-time, freelance, field-related employment relative to their degree•	Achieved more than an 85% placement rate in the first six months after graduation, consistently meeting or exceeding fiscal year employment and salary targets•	Awarded membership in the Top Achievers Group for The Art Institutes

I've know Brittany for several years now! Since I've known her, she has been working at the Art Institute of Phoenix where she has a tremendous amount of passion for her work!Her dedication and focus to her job makes her an incredible team player, and a value to any organization!   Her fun-loving personality and open-minded way of thinking makes her both a great teacher, and an inspiration to be around.Brittany has been involved in Ad 2 Phoenix for the last few years.  In her most recent role of Events Coordinator, she has taken the initiative to suggest ideas, do the leg work, and help implement some of our organization's best events to date!  Her attention to detail, and her value of the organization as a whole, helps us grow and continue to surpass the expectations of our members!  We are very fortunate to have Brittany on our team, and any organization, or company, would be too!
